flawed_nl_solution:
By the first two months, 1/5*200 = <<1/5*200=40>>40 mountains had erupted.
The total number of mountains remaining after the first round of explosions is 200-40= <<200-40=160>>160
When 2/5 of the remaining mountains exploded, the number of mountains that were still intact decreased by 2/5*160 = <<2/5*160=64>>64
The number of mountains that hadn't exploded after the second explosions is 160-64 = <<160-64=99>>99
When 1/2 of the mountains which were still intact exploded, the number of mountains that hadn't erupted was reduced by 1/2*99 = <<1/2*99=99/2>>99/2
At the end of the year, 99-99/2 = <<99-99/2=99/2>>99/2 mountains remained intact and hadn't exploded.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 96, not 99. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
